content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a cause that took place in ghent on march 18th 2023 the text discusses various legal arguments and judgments related to matrimonial property law separation of property unjust enrichment and other related matters it explores the applicability of article 1154 of the civil code regarding the capitalization of interest and the need for notice to be provided directly to the court the document also examines the financial contributions made during the marriage such as mortgage repayments architect fees and expenses related to property acquisition and construction it delves into the principles of unjust enrichment and argues that separation of property regimes and marriage contracts should prevent the recovery of disproportionate transfers of assets the text mentions the parties involved but their names are omitted it discusses the legal basis for the recovery of transfer assets and the conditions that need to be met it explains the concept of enrichment without cause and the role of the marriage contract in determining the property regime the text also discusses the claim for setoff or compensation for financial contributions made during the marriage it mentions the repayment of a mortgage loan and the financing of the completion of a building the text explains the role of the notaryliquidator in determining the amounts to be compensated and the objections raised by one party it discusses the conditions for the imposition of interest and the capitalization of interest the text concludes by stating that the claim for capitalization of interest is wellfounded
